Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility on grounds of organized criminality
Crimes.Basis_for_Inadmissibility: Membership in a criminal organization engaged in organized criminal activity
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Association with Los Zetas, receipt of drugs, provision of stolen goods, knowledge of operations
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: The Board found the applicant's actions indicated membership beyond mere social association
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Testimonial and operational details provided by or about the applicant
Crimes.Decision_Maker: Immigration Division of the Immigration and Refugee Board
Relevant_Factors_Considered: Nature of association with Los Zetas
Receipt and handling of illicit goods
Crimes.Credibility_Findings: Applicant’s involvement was more than incidental or social
Crimes.Evidence_Source: Board assessment based on submitted evidence and testimony
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Interpretation of 'membership' in a criminal organization
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Alleged errors in evidence interpretation and credibility assessment
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issue: Sufficiency and interpretation of evidence supporting membership
Crimes.Decision_Level: Administrative tribunal decision subject to judicial review
Crimes.Applicant_Status: Foreign national seeking entry or status in Canada
Crimes.Accusation: Membership in Los Zetas, a transnational criminal organization
Crimes.Risk_Nexus: Threat to Canada’s security due to organized crime links

Crimes.Basis_for_Inadmissibility: Membership in an organization engaged in organized criminal activity
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Associations with Los Zetas, participation in drug distribution, supply of stolen goods, operational knowledge
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Actions demonstrated active involvement, not just casual association
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Operational and testimonial evidence regarding gang activities
Crimes.Outcome: Found inadmissible due to criminal organization membership
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Denial: Membership in a criminal organization under s. 37(1)(a)
Crimes.Review_Mechanism: Federal Court appeal via judicial review
Relevant_Factors_Considered: Level of engagement with Los Zetas
Crimes.Credibility_Findings: Individual was complicit and integrated into the organization’s activities
Crimes.Evidence_Source: Information from investigations and applicant’s own statements
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Definition and threshold of 'membership' under IRPA
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Claimed unfair evaluation of evidence and credibility
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issue: Use of circumstantial and direct evidence to establish membership
Crimes.Accusation: Being part of the Los Zetas criminal organization
Crimes.Risk_Nexus: Potential threat posed by organized crime affiliation
